content.description: Bolted line 20' right of Succulent Mank. It follows two bolts up a lieback, then two more bolts of slab.
Climb the leftmost route on the main crag.  Climb onto the face and traverse around the block.  Follow the bolts up.  Bring a couple of long runners because the route zigzags.
content.protection: Four bolts and four bolt anchor.
content.location: Leftmost route on the main rock.

content.description: Sea Breeze ascends the northwest arete of the North Pinnacle. This route starts low(no stemming to the boulder!) and goes past 3 bolts before pulling onto the lower angle face past one more bolt to the top out.
content.protection: Four 1/2 inch rawl bolts. Stainless bolt anchor.
content.location: Sea Breeze is on the North Pinnacle, located about 200 yards north of the stairs. Sea Breeze faces west and is just east of Centipede.

content.description: MacIntosh follows the southeast arete on the North Pinnacle. At the top resist the temptation to grab for the arete and go left! This and the other routes on the pinnacle can be top roped by scrambling uop the east face.
content.protection: 3 bolts of questionable age. Stainless bolt anchor.
content.location: The North Pinnacle is at the far end of the beach about 200 yards north of the stairs. Rap off.

content.description: Local Motion takes the northeast arete of the North  Pinnacle. The bolts are way old so bring screamers or do this one on TR.
content.protection: 3 bolts. 4 bolts on top. The top anchors are stainless.
content.location: Local Motion is located on the furthest north pinnacle at Luffenholz. The pinnacle is about 30 feet east of the Centipede rock and about 200 yards from the stairs.

content.description: Climb the "flake" past a bolt then up through a few juggy moves to the tenuous top out. Bring screamers. Old bolts.
content.protection: 4 bolts. Tie off shrubs for the anchor. Walk off.
content.location: All of the Luffenholtz climbs are located at the north end of the beach. Descend the stairs, cross the creek and walk about 200 yards to the crags. IUD is the first route you will come to on the southwest face of the first "climbable" formation.

content.description: East Africa climbs the face 10 feet right of Centipede. It is decently protected where you need it but has deck fall potential above the first bolt. If you climb Centipede, it can be fun to top rope this one.
content.protection: Two 1/2 inch rawl bolts. Same anchor as Centipede(titanium glue-ins).
content.location: Located on the same rock as Centipede. Rap or down climb the northwest side.

content.description: Centipede is a 3 bolt route that ascends the free-standing boulder at the north end of the beach. This is a well protected climb that is a great first time lead or just a fun seaside outing. This route is usually accessible at all but the highest tides.
content.protection: 3 titanium glue-in bolts. 2 of the same on top.
content.location: Centipede is at the north end of Luffenholtz beach. Descend the access stairs and walk north 200 yards. continue past several formations on the right to a  "notch". Walk 50 feet northwest to the rock.

content.description: Back Door Man takes the west face of the North Pinnacle. Although this is a bolted route it is not a sport route! When Bob bolted it on lead, he broke an ankle and had to come back later to finish the route. Exciting! One of the best routes at Luffenholtz.
content.protection: 3 stainless bolts. These were replaced in the late 90's. Stainless anchor.
content.location: The North Pinnacle is about 200 yards north of the stairs. It is the farthest north of the crags at Luffenholtz.
